docs.lead_paragraph: The F.T.C. just approved a $29 billion merger of Express Scripts and Medco, but competition among pharmacy benefit managers appears to be alive and well.

headline.seo: Costs, Benefits and Your Prescription Plan
headline.main: Costs, Benefits and Your Drug Plan
headline.print_headline: Costs, Benefits and Your Drug Plan

docs.abstract: Editorial supports decision by the Federal Trade Commission to approve the merger between Express Scripts and Medco Health Solutions, two of the three largest companies that manage pharmaceutical benefits for employers and health plans; cites FTC's thorough eight-month inquiry as well as the growing number of competitors to the major providers.
docs.snippet: The F.T.C. just approved a $29 billion merger of Express Scripts and Medco, but competition among pharmacy benefit managers appears to be alive and well.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study of health care habits found that patients are still struggling to pay for medical care despite the economic recovery.

headline.seo: Americans Struggle With Medical Care Despite Economic Recovery
headline.main: Americans Cutting Back on Drugs and Doctor Visits
headline.print_headline: Americans Cutting Back on Drugs and Doctor Visits

docs.abstract: IMS Institute for Healthcare Informatics reports that patients cut back on prescription drugs and doctor visits in 2011, a sign that many Americans are still struggling to pay for health care despite the economic recovery; notes that prescriptions fell by 1.1 percent compared with 2010, and doctor visits fell by 4.7 percent.
docs.snippet: A study of health care habits found that patients are still struggling to pay for medical care despite the economic recovery.

docs.lead_paragraph: Top officials with the Food and Drug Administration contend the agency’s decisions should be divorced from politics and based solely on its own assessments of the science.

headline.seo: White House and F.D.A. at Odds on Regulatory Issues
headline.main: White House and the F.D.A. Often at Odds
headline.print_headline: White House And the F.D.A. Often at Odds

docs.abstract: Obama administration often disagrees with the Food and Drug Administration on regulatory issues, but FDA officials believe their decisions should be divorced from politics and based solely on their own scientific assessments; Republicans have relentlessly accused Obama of being an overzealous and job-killing regulator, forcing the administration to calibrate its election season positions (Series: Political Science).
docs.snippet: Top officials with the Food and Drug Administration contend the agency’s decisions should be divorced from politics and based solely on its own assessments of the science.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama declared he was confident the Supreme Court would uphold the legislation, saying it would be an “unprecedented, extraordinary” step to overturn it.

headline.seo: Obama Says He’s Confident Health Care Law Will Stand
headline.main: President Confident Health Law Will Stand
headline.print_headline: President Confident Health Law Will Stand

docs.abstract: Pres Obama declares that he is confident that the Supreme Court will uphold his health care law, saying it would be an unprecedented, extraordinary step to overturn the legislation.
docs.snippet: President Obama declared he was confident the Supreme Court would uphold the legislation, saying it would be an “unprecedented, extraordinary” step to overturn it.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: What science tells us about the incredible shrinking childhood.
docs.abstract: Growing trend of young girls entering puberty much earlier than they have in the past has perplexed endocrinologists and parents, particularly given studies that have shown the average of young girls' first period has remained fairly constant; doctors do not know exactly why trend is occurring, but have identified several contributing factors.
docs.snippet: What science tells us about the incredible shrinking childhood.
